listitem.para: Enables you to accept a connection over the network on the socket. To obtain the data received call NETACCEPTRECEIVEVALUE in your receiveready code. To turn off accept call NETACCEPTOFF. When data are available, &PRODUCTNAME; will run the receiveready instruction list. When you actually send data with NETACCEPTSENDVALUE it might output FALSE (meaning that it's not ready to send). If this happens you must wait until &PRODUCTNAME; runs the sendready instruction list before trying to send the data again. Note you cannot just send data from the sendready callback, it won't be run unless the previous send was blocked.
NETACCEPTON outputs TRUE if the command was successful. Otherwise it outputs FALSE.
The socket input is an integer that is used to identify which socket to listen on. This is used as the local port.

The sendready input is an instruction list (a list of instructions or a procedure name) to run when data is ready to send again. The first time sendready is run is when &PRODUCTNAME; successfully issued an accept. The second time sendready is run is when &PRODUCTNAME; accepts a connection. The third time sendready is run is when &PRODUCTNAME; is ready to send data. After that, sendready is run when &PRODUCTNAME; is ready to send after an earlier call to NETACCEPTSENDVALUE failed.
The receiveready input is an instruction list (a list of instructions or a procedure name) to run when data are available. &PRODUCTNAME; runs it whenever data is received and is ready to be read.

listitem.programlisting:
NETSTARTUP ; Start up the network
; Wait for someone to connect to you on socket 5124 SHOW NETACCEPTON 5124 [PRINT [Ready to send]] [PRINT [Ready to receive]] true
NETACCEPTOFF NETSHUTDOWN
